Modul htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer
Package htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.service

Klasse LeaderboardClient

java.lang.Object
htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.service.LeaderboardClient
public class LeaderboardClient extends Object
A client for interacting with the leaderboard server.

Provides functionality for fetching the leaderboard and submitting best times via HTTP.

  • Felddetails

    • SERVER_URL

      private static final String SERVER_URL
      The base URL of the leaderboard server.

      Used for sending and retrieving leaderboard data via HTTP requests.

      Siehe auch:

  • Methodendetails

    • fetchLeaderboard

      public Map<String,List<Map<String,Object>>> fetchLeaderboard() throws Exception
      Fetches the leaderboard data from the server.

      Sends a GET request to the server to retrieve the leaderboard data in JSON format. If the server responds with a non-200 status code, an exception is thrown. The response is parsed into a map structure for further processing.

      Gibt zurück:
      A map containing the leaderboard data, where each entry corresponds to a difficulty level (e.g., "beginner", "advanced", "pro"), and each entry is a list of player data (username and best time).
      Löst aus:
      Exception - if the request fails or if the response status code is not 200.

    • submitBestTime

      public void submitBestTime(String username, int time, String mode) throws Exception
      Submits the player's best time to the leaderboard server.

      Sends a POST request to the server with the player's username, best time, and the difficulty mode. If the server responds with a non-201 status code, an exception is thrown.

      Parameter:
      username - The username of the player whose best time is being submitted.
      time - The best time achieved by the player (in seconds).
      mode - The difficulty mode of the game (e.g., "beginner", "advanced", "pro").
      Löst aus:
      Exception - if the request fails or if the response status code is not 201 (Created).

    • parseJsonToMap

      private Map<String,List<Map<String,Object>>> parseJsonToMap(String json)
      Parses a JSON string into a map of leaderboard data.

      This method processes a JSON string representing the leaderboard data and converts it into a Map where the key is a string (difficulty level) and the value is a list of player data (represented as a map of key-value pairs). The method only processes entries that are arrays (list of player data), skipping non-array entries.

      Parameter:
      json - The JSON string representing the leaderboard data.
      Gibt zurück:
      A map where each key is a difficulty level, and each value is a list of player data.
      Löst aus:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the JSON string is malformed or does not follow the expected structure.

    • parseJsonArray

      private List<Map<String,Object>> parseJsonArray(String jsonArray)
      Parses a JSON array string into a list of maps representing the objects in the array.

      This method processes a JSON array string, extracting each object within the array and converting it into a map of key-value pairs. Each object is assumed to be enclosed in curly braces and parsed individually.

      Parameter:
      jsonArray - The JSON array string to parse.
      Gibt zurück:
      A list of maps, where each map represents an individual JSON object within the array.
      Löst aus:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the JSON array is malformed or contains mismatched braces.

    • parseJsonObject

      private Map<String,Object> parseJsonObject(String jsonObject)
      Parses a JSON object string into a map of key-value pairs.

      This method processes a JSON object string by splitting it into individual key-value pairs and then parsing each pair. It handles values that are strings or numbers, and logs any invalid entries.

      Parameter:
      jsonObject - The JSON object string to parse.
      Gibt zurück:
      A map representing the parsed key-value pairs from the JSON object.
      Löst aus:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the JSON object is malformed or does not start and end with curly braces.
